snippet: The Pentagon dropped “deconfliction” from its lexicon, and rejected the notion that the United States and Russia were coordinating their side-by-side military efforts in Syria.
abstract: American officials deny any suggestions they are coordinating attacks on Islamic State in Syria with Russians, who are supporting Pres Bashar al-Assad and targeting any opposition group, Islamic or otherwise; Defense Sec Ashton B Carter avoids use of 'deconfliction', term used in prior discussions regarding matter, saying conversations with Russia are 'basic technical discussions' on pilot safety procedures and not collaborations on military efforts.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The Pentagon dropped “deconfliction” from its lexicon, and rejected the notion that the United States and Russia were coordinating their side-by-side military efforts in Syria.

headline.main: A Semantic Downgrade for U.S.-Russian Talks About Operations in Syria
headline.print_headline: A Semantic Downgrade for U.S.-Russian Talks About Operations in Syria

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
